Plex has announced a series of changes—including a price hike, new remote playback fees, and updates to their privacy policy—and the internet has feelings. Linus and Luke dig into how Plex still exists despite its gray-area use cases, why LTT stopped taking sponsorships from them, and whether alternatives like Jellyfin are the better way forward. Also, is $250 for a lifetime Plex Pass still worth it?

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W7dLlJPtkW0

title: How does Plex exist?

Microsoft’s latest Windows update is causing problems… but it also accidentally removed Copilot—to the joy of many users. Linus and Luke discuss the surprising side effect of KB5053598, how the Windows 10 end-of-life could drive Linux adoption, and whether SteamOS might finally become a real desktop competitor.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W7dLlJPtkW0

Apple was forced to switch to USB-C, but that doesn’t mean they’re happy about it. Linus and Luke react to reports that Apple considered making a portless iPhone to skirt EU regulations—and why they might still do it soon. The guys also talk about Apple’s battery life advantages and why real-world performance matters more than benchmarks.
